file_content.text: Can't talk now. I've got information to get, lives to save.
I heard about your little "accident" with the pirate I sent you to free. All I can say is, I hope it really was an accident.
Ho ho, if it isn't the hero of the day! My agents picked Veem up outside the separatists' base.
He's already told us enough to crush the life out of this rebellion once and for all. Good work.
He better give you the information you need.
I hope he's useful.
And a fine job you did, soldier. You should be commended.
I'm not here to chat. You promised me credits.
Just pay me.
I guess we all have our priorities. But don't worry--I won't hold out on you.
It was easy.
Well, still, the Republic owes you a debt of gratitude.
The sooner you take care of those separatists, the better.
Well, hurry up.
All in good time. All in good time. It takes time to plan assaults, you know.
Here's your pay, and again, good work.
We need that pirate and we need him yesterday!
Let's keep this quick and quiet, shall we? I'm Milo Phipps, Strategic Information Service, former Senator, one-time governor of Dantooine.
You're a soldier--you must have heard about the separatists' base up in the volcano. The Republic needs someone tough to do some work up there--paid work.
I'm sure you do, soldier. That's just what I need for this delicate matter.
You do... "confidential" work, don't you? You've probably heard about the separatists' base up in the volcano. Well, the Republic needs someone to do some work there. Confidentially.
Perhaps I could help.
Good, good.
Is there pay?
Oh, you'll be well compensated--have no doubts about that.
What makes you think that's me, fatso?
You're an idiot.
Fatso! Do you know who I am? I am Milo Phipps! I was a Republic Senator for ten years. I was governor of Dantooine!
It was a joke.
Oh, well then. Ho ho. Very funny. Now, moving along.
Like I said, I represent the Republic here on Ord Mantell, and an item has come up that I think you can help us with.
But it'll require you to break into the separatists' base and take out their toughest guards.
It's my duty.
The separatists will need more than a few guards to stop me.
I'm not scared.
Very good. Very, very good.
If I'm going to take all the risks, the pay better be good.
If the price is right.
It will be. You think the Republic's stingy?
Let me stress that this is a very sensitive matter. The Republic promised protection to a pirate a few months back--a pirate with whom we share common enemies.
Recently, those enemies--the separatists--captured that pirate and are holding him at their base. We need someone to free him.
That's insane.
You must understand, returning this pirate to us could mean the end of the separatist movement.
I hate to be the one to break it to you, but you're not governor here.
This isn't Dantooine.
You clearly know how to throw your weight around.
Sounds like a heavy burden.
I do not have to put up with this insolence! I wouldn't even speak to you if I didn't require someone with your brutish abilities.
The separatists are holding a Rodian pirate by the name of Veem Set in their base. The Republic wants him freed, and we're willing to pay substantial sums for it.
Now, tell me, are you going to turn down all those credits just to stand here and insult me, or are you going to free that pirate?
Why does the Republic wanna free a pirate?
Why a pirate?
I know, I know. Better to lock them up and throw away the key, right? Wrong. This pirate knows enough to end this war--at least on Ord Mantell.
Credits are my not-so-secret weakness.
I do love credits.
Then it seems we're in business. If you have any love for the Republic, you won't regret it.
I'm not helping a pirate.
No way.
Ord Mantell is a filthy stinkhole of corruption, so I don't expect loyalty from the likes of you. Hopefully, money will make you listen.
This pirate approached us with information on the separatists and their operations in exchange for protection from the same. His relationship with them went sour, see.
But the separatists got to him before we did. The Republic promised protection. I'm asking you to keep that promise--by breaking him out. Can you do it?
It's my duty to serve the Republic, and if freeing this pirate helps in any way, I'm glad to help.
For the Republic!
No need to be overzealous, but your eagerness is appreciated.
It's tempting, but pirates tend to cut into my profits.
I don't like pirates.
Of course.
I'd sooner wrestle a rancor with my bare hands than help a pirate--not that I'm itching to do either.
Not a chance.
Don't think of it as helping a pirate. Think of it as helping a reformed pirate. Think of it as helping the Republic--for a healthy profit.
Oh okay.
Good, thank you. That's what I expect from a true citizen of the Republic.
I'm very busy. We'll see if I get the time.
Maybe.
Well, I hope you will decide in our favor. It will be a great service to the Republic. And, might I add, the reward is quite handsome.
Go speak to my man at the entrance to the fort--Lieutenant Bendick. He'll fill you in on the details.
I'll speak to him right away.
Immediately.
Yes, yes. Thank you, and good luck.
Maybe.
I don't ask for promises, just a job well done.
Save your thank-yous and throw in a few more credits.
Just pay me extra.
Fair enough. A few more credits it is.
The answer's still "no."
Nope. [Refuse quest]
Then stop wasting my time. If you won't get this guy out, then I need to find someone who will. Move along.
I'm a busy man. Please find someone else to talk to.
Payment isn't necessary.
Paid work is the best kind.
